Class TextBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • TextBook

  • public class TextBook
extends java.lang.Object
    The Textbook Class represents a textbook object, where textbooks will have a set number of chapters, that the students can read. This is needed for when the student studies. Bayley Cowen-Seagrove 4.1.2 ver 1

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextBook(java.lang.String t, int n)
      Constructor for objects of class Textbook, used to initialize Textbook objects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void closeBook()
      closeBook method sets the chaptersRead back to 0.
      void describe()
      Describe method that represents the textbook in terms of its title, with the number of chapter left to be read.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      getTitle method gets the title of a textbook.
      boolean isFinished()
      isFinished method checks whether the student has read all of the chapters.
      void readNextChapter()
      readNextChapter checks whether the textbook is finished, else increments the number of chapters read by 1.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextBook

        public TextBook(java.lang.String t,
                int n)
        Constructor for objects of class Textbook, used to initialize Textbook objects. Sets the title, number of chapters for a textbook, and sets the chapters read to 0.
        Parameters:
        t - String Title of the textbook
        n - Integer to represent the number of chapter

    • Method Detail

      • closeBook

        public void closeBook()
        closeBook method sets the chaptersRead back to 0. This means that the book has been read, and can be returned.

      • describe

        public void describe()
        Describe method that represents the textbook in terms of its title, with the number of chapter left to be read. This is helpful to see how much a textbook has left before being finished.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        getTitle method gets the title of a textbook. This is useful as it is needed in the describe method.
        Returns:
        title String which is the title of the textbook.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        isFinished method checks whether the student has read all of the chapters. This is used to check whether the student should keep reading in readNextChapter.
        Returns:
        Boolean Returns true if all chapters have been read, else returns false

      • readNextChapter

        public void readNextChapter()
        readNextChapter checks whether the textbook is finished, else increments the number of chapters read by 1. This is used by students when studying to enable them to work through a textbook.
